properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 2:40PM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...SNOW TO SPREAD ACROSS AREAS ALONG AND NORTH OF I-70 ON
WEDNESDAY...

.Precipitation will overspread much of central Illinois through
the morning into the afternoon, with rain possibly mixed with
sleet south of Interstate 70, while areas north of Interstate 70
should be mostly snow. Precipitation will continue Wednesday
night and into early Thursday, with snow accumulations of 3 to 4
inches with some 5 inch amounts possible. Much colder air will
move into the area Thursday with some blowing snow possible.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of central and east central Illinois from
Interstate 55 southeastward along and just south of the
Interstate 74 corridor to the Indiana border.

* WHEN...From 11 AM Wednesday to 10 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will impact the evening commute, with some lingering
slippery conditions and patchy blowing snow for the Thursday
morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY
